ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] The ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers specified by this protocol [MS-OXCFOLD] are sent to and received by the server by using the underlying Remote Operations (ROP) List and Encoding Protocol, as specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In ROPs] The format of ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers that are specific to folder operations is specified in sections 2.2.1.1 through 2.2.1.14.
[In ROPs] For ROPs that require a folder identifier or a message identifier, the client needs to acquire those identifiers for the objects to be used in the ROP requests.
[In ROPs] For more details about acquiring message identifiers, including usages, restrictions , and notes, see [MS-OXCMSG].

[In ROPs] Some fields [RopId field and LogonId field] are not included in the ROP specifications. The descriptions of ROP request buffers do not include the RopId field and the LogonId field. The descriptions of the ROP response buffers do not include the RopId field and the fields that specify handle indexes.
[In ROPs] For details about these fields [RopId field, LogonId field and the fields that specify handle indexes], see [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP] The RopOpenFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.1) opens an existing folder.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP] The folder can be [either a public folder or] a private mailbox folder.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP] The folder can be either a public folder [or a private mailbox folder].
[In RopOpenFolder ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request buffer and the ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopOpenFolder ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenFolder ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.1.1).
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.

[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation [RopOpenFolder ROP] is a Logon object [or a Folder object] that represents the object to be opened.

[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation [RopOpenFolder ROP] is a [Logon object] or a Folder object that represents the object to be opened.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): For details about Logon objects, see [MS-OXCSTOR].
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object is stored.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): The output Server object for this operation [RopOpenFolder ROP] is a Folder object that represents the folder that was opened.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): A Folder ID (FID) structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) that specifies the folder to be opened.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R2175.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): A set of bits that indicate the mode for opening the folder.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): The valid bits [0x04] for this field [OpenModeFlags] are specified in the following table.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): All other bits [except 0x04] MUST NOT be set by the client.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): All other bits [except 0x04] MUST be ignored by the server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFOLD_R465.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): The value of OpenSoftDeleted is 0x04.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): If this bit [OpenSoftDeleted] is set, the operation opens either an existing folder or a soft-deleted folder.<1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R22001, MS-OXCFOLD_R22003, MS-OXCFOLD_R22004.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenModeFlags (1 byte): If this bit [OpenSoftDeleted] is not set, the operation opens an existing folder.<1>
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenFolder ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.1.2).
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An integer that indicates the result of the operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R24, MS-OXCFOLD_R468, MS-OXCFOLD_R469, MS-OXCFOLD_R470, MS-OXCFOLD_R471, MS-OXCFOLD_R472, MS-OXCFOLD_R473.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): The server returns 0x00000000 to indicate success.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For details about common error codes, see [MS-OXCDATA].
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] HasRules (1 byte): A Boolean value that indicates whether rules are associated with the folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R25, MS-OXCFOLD_R26.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] HasRules (1 byte): If rules are associated with the folder, this field [HasRules] is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.<2>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R25001, MS-OXCFOLD_R25002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] HasRules (1 byte): otherwise [If rules are not associated with the folder], this field [HasRules] is set to zero (FALSE).
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] HasRules (1 byte): For details about rules, see [MS-OXORULE].
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsGhosted (1 byte): A Boolean value that indicates whether the server hosts an active replica of the folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R907, MS-OXCFOLD_R29.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] If the server does not host an active replica of the folder, this field [IsGhosted] is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsGhosted (1 byte): otherwise [If the server hosts an active replica of the folder], this field [IsGhosted] is set to zero (FALSE).
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsGhosted (1 byte): This field [IsGhosted] is present only for folders that are in a public store.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] ServerCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of servers that have a replica of the folder.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [ServerCount] is present only if the IsGhosted field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] CheapServerCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of the cheapest, same-cost servers at the front of the server list.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] The value of this field [CheapServerCount] MUST be less than or equal to the value of the ServerCount field.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [CheapServerCount] is present only if the IsGhosted field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] Servers (variable): An array of null-terminated ASCII strings, each of which specifies a server that has a replica of the folder.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] The number of strings contained in this field [Servers] is specified by the ServerCount field.
[In RopOpenFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [Servers] is present only if the IsGhosted field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP] The RopCreateFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.2) creates a new folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP] The folder can be [either a public folder or] a private mailbox folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP] The folder can be either a public folder [or a private mailbox folder].
[In RopCreateFolder ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request buffer and the ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopCreateFolder ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCreateFolder ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.2.1).
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.

[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation [RopCreateFolder ROP] is a Folder object that represents the parent folder of the folder to be created.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object is stored.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): The output Server object for this operation is a Folder object that represents the folder that was created.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderType (1 byte): An integer that specifies the type of folder to be created.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderType (1 byte): One of the values [1,2] specified in the following table MUST be used.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderType (1 byte): The value 1 indicates the folder type is Generic folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderType (1 byte): The value 2 indicates the folder type is Search folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] UseUnicodeStrings (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if the values of the DisplayName and Comment fields are formatted in Unicode.

[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] UseUnicodeStrings (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) otherwise [if the values of the DisplayName and Comment fields are not formatted in Unicode.].

[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenExisting (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if a pre-existing folder, whose name is identical to the name specified in the DisplayName field, is to be opened.

[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] OpenExisting (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) otherwise [if a pre-existing folder, whose name is identical to the name specified in the DisplayName field, is not to be opened.].
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] Reserved (1 byte): This field is reserved.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] Reserved (1 byte): The client MUST set this field [Reserved] to zero (FALSE).
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] DisplayName (variable): A null-terminated string that specifies the display name of the folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] DisplayName (variable): This name [DisplayName] becomes the value of the new folder's PidTagDisplayName property (section 2.2.2.2.2.5).
[InRopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] Comment (variable): A null-terminated folder string that specifies a comment associated with the new folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Request Buffer] Comment (variable): This string [Comment] becomes the value of the new folder's PidTagComment property (section 2.2.2.2.2.2).
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCreateFolder ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.2.2).
[RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An integer that indicates the result of the operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R58, MS-OXCFOLD_R486, MS-OXCFOLD_R487, MS-OXCFOLD_R1069, MS-OXCFOLD_R1070, MS-OXCFOLD_R1071, MS-OXCFOLD_R489, MS-OXCFOLD_R491, MS-OXCFOLD_R493, MS-OXCFOLD_R494, MS-OXCFOLD_R495, MS-OXCFOLD_R1072, MS-OXCFOLD_R1073.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): The server returns 0x00000000 to indicate success.
[RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For details about common error codes, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.
[RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): A Folder ID (FID) structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) that specifies the folder that was created or opened.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R2175.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsExistingFolder (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if a public folder with the name given by the DisplayName field of the request buffer (section 2.2.1.2.1) already exists.<3>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R60001, MS-OXCFOLD_R60002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsExistingFolder (1 byte): The value is zero (FALSE) if a public folder with that name does not exist.
[RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [IsExistingFolder] applies only to a folder that is created in a public message store.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R60001, MS-OXCFOLD_R60002, MS-OXCFOLD_R1197.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] The server always sets this field [IsExistingFolder] to zero for a folder that is created in a private mailbox.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] HasRules (1 byte): A Boolean value that indicates whether rules are associated with the folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R923, MS-OXCFOLD_R924.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] If rules are associated with the folder, this field [HasRules] is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] Otherwise [if rules are not associated with the folder], this field [HasRules] is set to zero (FALSE).
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] For details about rules, see [MS-OXORULE].
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [HasRules] is present only if the IsExistingFolder field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsGhosted (1 byte): A Boolean value that indicates whether the server hosts an active replica of the folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R929, MS-OXCFOLD_R68.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] If the folder is not an active replica, it is a ghosted folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] If the server does not host an active replica of the folder, this field [IsGhosted] is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] IsGhosted (1 byte): otherwise [If the server hosts an active replica of the folder], this field [IsGhosted] is set to zero (FALSE).
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [IsGhosted] is present only if the IsExistingFolder field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value and only for folders that are in a public message store.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] ServerCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of servers that have a replica of the folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [ServerCount] is present only if the IsGhosted field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] CheapServerCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of the cheapest, same-cost servers.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] These servers are listed at the beginning of the array contained in the Servers field.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] The value of this field [CheapServerCount] MUST be less than or equal to the value of the ServerCount field.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] And [the value of this field "CheapServerCount"] MUST be greater than zero when the value of the ServerCount field is greater than zero.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [CheapServerCount] is present only if the IsGhosted field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] Servers (variable): An array of null-terminated ASCII strings, each of which specifies a server that has a replica of the folder.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] The number of strings contained in this field [Servers] is specified by the ServerCount field.
[In RopCreateFolder ROP Response Buffer] This field [Servers] is present only if the IsGhosted field is set to a nonzero (TRUE) value.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP] The RopDeleteFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.3) removes a folder.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP] By default, the RopDeleteFolder ROP operates only on empty folders.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP] The folder can be [either a public folder or] a private mailbox folder.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP] The folder can be either a public folder [or a private mailbox folder].
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request buffer and the ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopDeleteFolder ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.3.1).
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation is a Folder object that represents the parent folder of the folder to be deleted.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): A set of bits that control the deletion of a folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R82, MS-OXCFOLD_R762, MS-OXCFOLD_R763, MS-OXCFOLD_R764, MS-OXCFOLD_R814, MS-OXCFOLD_R497.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): By default, the RopDeleteFolder ROP operates only on empty folders, but it [RopDeleteFolder ROP] can be used successfully on non-empty folders by setting the DEL_FOLDERS bit and the DEL_MESSAGES bit.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): The valid bits [0x01, 0x04, 0x10] for this field [DeleteFolderFlags] are listed in the following table.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] The client MUST NOT set any other bits.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): DEL_MESSAGES (0x01) means that the folder and all of the Message objects in the folder are deleted.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): DEL_FOLDERS (0x04) means that the folder and all of its subfolders are deleted.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): If this bit [DELETE_HARD_DELETE (0x10)] is set, the folder MAY <4> be hard deleted.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R764001, MS-OXCFOLD_R764002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] DeleteFolderFlags (1 byte): If this bit [DELETE_HARD_DELETE (0x10)] is not set, the folder is soft deleted.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): A FID structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) that specifies the folder to be deleted.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R2175.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopDeleteFolder ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.3.2).
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An integer that indicates the result of the operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R95, MS-OXCFOLD_R2500, MS-OXCFOLD_R502, MS-OXCFOLD_R503, MS-OXCFOLD_R504, MS-OXCFOLD_R507, MS-OXCFOLD_R508, MS-OXCFOLD_R510, MS-OXCFOLD_R509, MS-OXCFOLD_R2509.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): The server returns 0x00000000 to indicate success.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For details about common error codes, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] PartialCompletion (1 byte): A Boolean value that specifies whether the ROP fails for a subset of targets.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFOLD_R97, MS-OXCFOLD_R948.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] If the ROP fails for a subset of targets, the value of this field [PartialCompletion] is nonzero (TRUE).
[In RopDeleteFolder ROP Response Buffer] PartialCompletion (1 byte): otherwise [if the ROP successes for a subset of targets], the value is zero (FALSE).
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP] The RopSetSearchCriteria ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.4) establishes search criteria for a search folder.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request buffer and the ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetSearchCriteria ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.4.1).

[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation is a Folder object that represents the search folder.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionDataSize (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the size of the RestrictionData field.

[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionDataSize (2 bytes): If the value of the RestrictionDataSize field is zero, the search criteria that were used most recently for the search folder container are used again.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionDataSize (2 bytes): The RestrictionDataSize field MUST NOT be set to zero for the first search.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionData (variable): A packet of structures that specify restrictions for the search folder.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] The size of this field [RestrictionData] is specified by the value of the RestrictionDataSize field.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionData (variable): For details about the structures that are used to specify restrictions, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] FolderIdCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of structures contained in the FolderIds field.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] FolderIdCount (2 bytes): If the FolderIdCount field is set to zero, the folders that were used in the most recent search are used again.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] FolderIdCount (2 bytes): The FolderIdCount field MUST NOT be set to zero for the first search within a search folder container.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] FolderIds (variable): An array of FID structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1), each of which specifies a folder that will be searched.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] The number of structures [FolderIds] contained in the array is specified by the value of the FolderIdCount field.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): A set of bits that control the search for a search folder.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): For more details about how these bits affect the search, see section 3.2.5.4.

[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): The valid bits [0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000004, 0x00000008, 0x00000010, 0x00000020, 0x00010000, 0x00020000, 0x00040000] for this field [SearchFlags] are listed in the following table.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): The client MUST NOT set any other bits.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes):STOP_SEARCH (0x00000001) means that the search is aborted.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [STOP_SEARCH (0x00000001)] MUST NOT be set at the same time as the RESTART_SEARCH bit.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If neither [STOP_SEARCH or RESTART_SEARCH] bit is set, the default is RESTART_SEARCH.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): RESTART_SEARCH (0x00000002) means that the search is initiated, if this is the first RopSetSearchCriteria ROP request.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): RESTART_SEARCH (0x00000002) means that the search is initiated, if the search is restarted.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): RESTART_SEARCH (0x00000002) means that the search is initiated, if the search is inactive.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [RESTART_SEARCH (0x00000002)] MUST NOT be set at the same time as the STOP_SEARCH bit.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If neither [RESTART_SEARCH or STOP_SEARCH] bit is set, the default is RESTART_SEARCH.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFOLD_R1198.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): RECURSIVE_SEARCH (0x00000004) means that the search includes the search folder containers and all of their child folders.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [RECURSIVE_SEARCH (0x00000004)] MUST NOT be set at the same time as the SHALLOW_SEARCH bit.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If neither bit [RECURSIVE_SEARCH or SHALLOW_SEARCH] is set, the default is SHALLOW_SEARCH.

[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SHALLOW_SEARCH (0x00000008) means that the search includes only the search folder containers that are specified in the FolderIds field.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [SHALLOW_SEARCH (0x00000008)] MUST NOT be set at the same time as the RECURSIVE_SEARCH bit.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If neither bit [SHALLOW_SEARCH or RECURSIVE_SEARCH] is set, the default is SHALLOW_SEARCH.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFOLD_R1200.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH (0x00010000) means that the search uses a content-indexed search.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH] MUST NOT be set at the same time as the NON_CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH bit.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If neither bit [CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH or NON_CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH ]is set, the default is at the discretion of the server.

[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] [If neither bit [CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH or NON_CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH ]is set, the default is at the discretion of the server.] For more details, see section 3.2.5.4.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): NON_CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH (0x00020000) means that the search does not use a content-indexed search.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [NON_CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH] MUST NOT be set at the same time as the CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH bit.
[In RopSetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If neither bit [NON_CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH or CONTENT_INDEXED_SEARCH ]is set, the default is at the discretion of the server.

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP] The RopGetSearchCriteria ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.5) obtains the search criteria and the status of a search for a search folder.

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] UseUnicode (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if the value of the RestrictionData field of the ROP response is to be in Unicode format.

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] UseUnicode (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) otherwise [if the value of the RestrictionData field of the ROP response is not to be in Unicode format].
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] IncludeRestriction (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if the restriction data is required in the response.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] IncludeRestriction (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) otherwise [if the restriction data is not required in the response].

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Request Buffer] IncludeFolders (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) otherwise [if the list of folders being searched is not required in the response].

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An integer that indicates the result of the operation.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes):The valid bits [0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000004, 0x00000008, 0x00001000, 0x00002000, 0x00010000, 0x00020000, 0x01000000, 0x02000000, 0x04000000, 0x08000000] for this field [SearchFlags] are listed in the following table.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] The client MUST ignore any other bits.

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SEARCH_RUNNING (0x00000001) means that the search is running, which means that the initial population of the search folder still being compiled.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SEARCH_REBUILD (0x00000002) means that the search is in the CPU-intensive part of the search.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): This bit [SEARCH_REBUILD (0x00000002)] is set only if the SEARCH_RUNNING bit is also set.

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): If this bit [SEARCH_RECURSIVE (0x00000004)] is set, the specified search folder containers and all their child search folder containers are searched for matching entries.

[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] If this bit [SEARCH_RECURSIVE] is not set, only the search folder containers that are specified in the last RopSetSearchCriteria ROP request (section 2.2.1.4.1) are being searched.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SEARCH_COMPLETE (0x00001000) means that the search results are complete.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SEARCH_PARTIAL (0x00002000) means that only some parts of messages were included.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SEARCH_STATIC (0x00010000) means that the search is static.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): SEARCH_MAYBE_STATIC (0x00020000) means that the search is still being evaluated.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): CI_TOTALLY (0x01000000) means that the search is done using content indexing.
[In RopGetSearchCriteria ROP Response Buffer] SearchFlags (4 bytes): TWIR_TOTALLY (0x08000000) means that the search is done without using content indexing.

The complete syntax of the ROP request buffer and the ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.10.1).

[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.

[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation [RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP] is a Folder object that represents the folder whose messages and subfolders will be hard deleted.
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] WantAsynchronous (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if the ROP is to be processed asynchronously.
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] WantAsynchronous (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) if the ROP is to be processed synchronously.
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] WantDeleteAssociated (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if the FAI messages are to be included in the deletion.
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Request Buffer] WantDeleteAssociated (1 byte): The value is zero (FALSE) otherwise [if the FAI messages are not to be included in the deletion].

[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.10.2).
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An integer that indicates the result of the operation.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): The server returns 0x00000000 to indicate success.
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For details about common error codes, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.
[In RopHardDeleteMessagesAndSubfolders ROP Response Buffer] PartialCompletion (1 byte): A Boolean value that specifies whether the ROP fails for a subset of targets.

[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] The RopDeleteMessages ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.11) is used to soft delete one or more messages from a folder.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] This ROP [RopDeleteMessages] applies to both public folders [and private mailboxes].
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] This ROP [RopDeleteMessages] applies to [both public folders and] private mailboxes.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] A message that has been soft deleted can be recovered only by opening it, copying it to a new message, and then saving the new message.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] For details about opening and saving a Message object, see [MS-OXCMSG].
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] For details about copying a Message object from one folder to another, see section 3.1.4.7.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request buffer and the ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopDeleteMessages ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.11.1).
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An integer that specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.

[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): The input Server object for this operation [RopDeleteMessages ROP] is a Folder object that represents the folder that contains the messages to be soft deleted.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] WantAsynchronous (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if the ROP is to be processed asynchronously.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] WantAsynchronous (1 byte): [A Boolean value that is] zero (FALSE) if the ROP is to be processed synchronously.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] WantAsynchronous (1 byte): For details about asynchronous processing, see section 3.1.5.2.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] NotifyNonRead (1 byte): A Boolean value that is nonzero (TRUE) if a non-read receipt is to be generated for the deleted messages.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] NotifyNonRead (1 byte): The value [NotifyNonRead] is zero (FALSE) otherwise [if a non-read receipt is not to be generated for the deleted messages].
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] MessageIdCount (2 bytes): An integer that specifies the number of structures contained in the MessageIds field.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] MessageIds (variable): An array of MID structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2), each of which specifies a message to be deleted.
[In RopDeleteMessages ROP Request Buffer] MessageIds (variable): The number of structures contained in the array is specified by the value of the MessageIdCount field.
